**MM I — WACC and Value (no taxes)**

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false

set.seed(778)
library(webexercises)
library(knitr)
suppressWarnings(suppressMessages({
  ok <- requireNamespace("kableExtra", quietly = TRUE)
  if (ok) library(kableExtra)
}))

# Randomized parameters
FCFF <- round(runif(1, 15, 40), 2)          # in millions, perpetuity
rU   <- round(runif(1, 0.07, 0.10), 4)      # unlevered cost
rD   <- round(runif(1, 0.03, 0.06), 4)      # cost of debt
DE    <- round(runif(1, 0.30, 1.20), 2)     # D/E ratio

# Target results
rE   <- rU + DE * (rU - rD)                 # MM with no taxes
wE   <- 1/(1 + DE)
wD   <- DE/(1 + DE)
WACC <- wE * rE + wD * rD                   # should equal rU in perfect market
VU   <- round(FCFF / rU, 2)                 # millions
# display text



```


A firm operates in a perfect capital market (no taxes) with perpetual free cash flow to the firm (FCFF) of `r round(FCFF,2)` million per year. Its unlevered cost of capital is r<sub>U</sub> = `r round(100*rU,2)`%, the cost of debt is r<sub>D</sub> = `r round(100*rD,2)`%,  and the target leverage is D/E = `r DE`.  Compute: **(a)** the levered cost of equity r<sub>E</sub> (in %); **(b)** the WACC (in %); and **(c)** the levered firm value V<sub>L</sub> (in millions).
